meanings.definition: Persuade (someone) to do something by means of deception or flattery.
meanings.sent1: She tried to inveigle her friend into sharing her toys by complimenting her.
meanings.sent2: The salesman managed to inveigle the customer into buying a product he didn't need.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to inveigle the dog into chasing its tail by pretending to be scared.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox inveigled the rabbit out of its burrow with promises of a grand adventure.
meanings.sent5: The sly magician inveigled the audience into believing he could make things disappear.

meanings.definition: Obtain (something) by persuading someone through deception or flattery.
meanings.sent1: He managed to inveigle a free meal from his friend by pretending he had forgotten his wallet.
meanings.sent2: The con artist inveigled money from unsuspecting victims by pretending to be a charity worker.
meanings.sent3: The clever raccoon inveigled its way into the picnic basket and stole some sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The smooth-talking politician inveigled support from the crowd by promising unrealistic changes.
meanings.sent5: The charming actor inveigled the director into giving him the lead role in the play.
